sourceText: Share with colleagues, friends and family | Spread the word | Keep children safe online.
text: Share with colleagues, friends and family | Spread the word | Keep children safe online.

sourceText: Keep your child safe with open communication.
text: Keep your child safe with open communication.

sourceText: Tell your children that if they experience something online that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.
text: Tell your children that if they experience something online that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.

sourceText: Be alert to signs of distress.  Notice if your child is being withdrawn, upset, secretive, or obsessed with online activities.
text: Be alert to signs of distress.  Notice if your child is being withdrawn, upset, secretive, or obsessed with online activities.

sourceText: Create trusting relationships and open communication through positive support and encouragement.
text: Create trusting relationships and open communication through positive support and encouragement.

sourceText: Note that every child is unique and may use different ways to communicate.Take time to adjust your message for your child’s needs.
text: Note that every child is unique and may use different ways to communicate.Take time to adjust your message for your child’s needs.

sourceText: For example, children with learning disabilities, may require information in simple formats.
text: For example, children with learning disabilities, may require information in simple formats.

sourceText: Children and teens are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps them reduce the impact of COVID-19 and encourages them to continue with their lives… but it also presents risks and dangers.
text: Children and teens are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps them reduce the impact of COVID-19 and encourages them to continue with their lives… but it also presents risks and dangers.

sourceText: Spend time with your child or teen online.
text: Spend time with your child or teen online.

sourceText: Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.
text: Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.

sourceText: Talk to your teen on how to report inappropriate content (see below).
text: Talk to your teen on how to report inappropriate content (see below).

sourceText: has great advice for apps, games and entertainment for different ages.
text: has great advice for apps, games and entertainment for different ages.

sourceText: Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.

sourceText: Harmful content – violence, misogyny, xenophobia, inciting suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography  etc.
text: Harmful content – violence, misogyny, xenophobia, inciting suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography  etc.

sourceText: Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
text: Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.

text: The COVID-19 Playful Parenting Emergency Response is supported by the LEGO Foundation, the philanthropic donors to the University of Oxford’s COVID-19 Research Response Fund, and the UKRI GCRF Accelerating Achievement for Africa’s Adolescents (Accelerate) Hub. Research on Parenting for Lifelong Health is supported by the UKRI GCRF Accelerate Hub, the Oak Foundation, the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Seventh Framework Programme and the Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme, the Global Alliance for Chronic Diseases under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme, UNICEF, WHO, Oxford University Innovation GCRF Sustainable Impact Fund, the Leverhulme Trust, the Economic and Social Research Council, CIDA, the National Research Foundation of South Africa, Ilifa Labantwana, the John Fell Fund, the Evaluation Fund, the UBS Optimus Foundation, USAID-PEPFAR, the Wellcome Trust, Grand Challenges Canada and Wellspring Advisors.

sourceText: Create healthy and safe online habits.
text: Create healthy and safe online habits.

sourceText: in creating family tech agreements about healthy device use.
text: in creating family tech agreements about healthy device use.

sourceText: Create device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: Create device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).

sourceText: Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!
text: Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!

sourceText: Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).

sourceText: Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.
text: Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.

sourceText: Tech fixes to protect your children online.
text: Tech fixes to protect your children online.

sourceText: Cover webcams when not in use.
text: Cover webcams when not in use.
